questions.question: What are the two main phases of industrialization examined in the module?
options: The Early Industrial Revolution and the Late Industrial Revolution
The First Industrial Revolution and the Second Industrial Revolution
The Steam Revolution and the Electricity Revolution
The Textile Revolution and the Transportation Revolution

questions.question: What year is considered the start of the First Industrial Revolution?
Who invented the Spinning Jenny in 1764?
The Puddling Furnace, developed by Henry Cort, was used for what purpose?
What was the primary function of the Cotton Gin, invented by Eli Whitney?
options: To create wrought iron for industrial machinery
To speed up the separation of cotton fibers from seeds
To improve the efficiency of textile production by spinning multiple threads
To facilitate faster transportation through improved roads

questions.question: Macadamized Roads, created by John Loudon McAdam, improved transportation by using what method?
options: Compacted stone layers for better drainage and durability

questions.question: The Second Industrial Revolution brought advancements in which areas?
Who patented the first practical telephone in 1876?
The development of the internal combustion engine in 1876 by Nikolaus Otto provided what?
options: A more efficient method for separating cotton fibers
A precursor to the electric light bulb
A more efficient alternative to steam power
A method for creating higher-quality wrought iron
